news-item.text: Began teaching Current State and Future of Generative AI (ESTEEM 60244-01), a graduate course exploring AI foundations, ethics, and innovation.
Named as a part of the Institute for Social Concerns Graduate Justice Fellowship 2025-2026 cohort
Presented Mainstream News Narratives on Youth Online Safety at CSCW 2024 in Costa Rica
Presented early results on algorithmic publics and event-based virality at AoIR 2024 doctoral colloquium.
Presented Viblio: Introducing Credibility Signals on YouTube at CHI 2024.
Awarded Best Research Pitch, Honorable Mention at the Notre Dame Computer Science and Engineering Poster Fair
Joined the Weninger Lab at the University of Notre Dame as a PhD student in Computer Science & Engineering
Awarded the Jack and Mary Ann Remick Graduate Fellowship in Engineering to study at the University of Notre Dame
Graduated from the University of Washington with a BS in Informatics and a BA in Drawing & Painting
Presented Viblio: Enhancing Credibility Awareness on YouTube at University of Washington's Undergraduate Research Symposium
Presented workshop paper on Viblio at ICWSM 2021
